message: Is there is a function that takes matrix as parameter and draw it or at least preview it in a decent way so i can see different cells with different colors ?

data.message: Would you specify more? Are you asking for a function in a specific Programming language, or you just need a tool for visualizing your data?
A function in any language I'm using java

Then, I'd recommend going with any statistical computing programming language as they meant to solve such problems. 

R programming language, in my opinion, will be very helpful in your case. 

You can start by this simple Codeschool tutorial:
-- http://tryr.codeschool.com/levels/1/challenges/1
-- https://www.codeschool.com/courses/try-r

Then, take a look at these articles:
-- http://www.phaget4.org/R/image_matrix.html
-- http://www2.warwick.ac.uk/fac/sci/moac/people/students/peter_cock/r/matrix_contour/

Octave is another opensource good option: https://www.gnu.org/software/octave/

You could try Octave:
Let matrix A be the matrix you want to plot,
imagesc(A)  
%would give different color representation for each number.
imagesc(A), colorbar, colormap gray;
% same thing but with different shades of gray.

This would probably work on Matlab too (as most commands work on Octave work on Matlab), however I only tried it on Octave.
